Reviews.Title: “good for the Centre”
Reviews.Author: Pam-Ruislip
Reviews.Content: We had a short break in Barcelona and stayed in the Montblanc. As we had our parents with us, we wanted a hotel near to the centre and this is the hotel. The Playa de Catalunya was a few minutes walk away (for the tourist buses) and the metro too was close by. The hotel was popular with tourists and the reception staff were very helpful with information to make trips easier. Breakfast was not included in our package and we could have had breakfast in the hotel for 18 euros each - a bit pricey. We did however find plenty of coffee shops nearby where we had a coffee and croissant for a few euros - a better option we found. Over the time we were in Barcelona, we found that most of the restaurants had good lunchtime offers - 2 courses and wine/beer or sangria for between 15 to 18 euros each - good value. We bought a two day pass on the tourist buses and used these as our normal method of transport. There was only one problem with getting back on the bus at Montjuic castle - we had to wait as a number of buses came but were all full! Barcelona continues to be very popular with tourists! We were leaving on the morning of the Barcelona marathon and the reception staff were very helpful in keeping us up to speed on the travel information and when the roads would be closed - we eventually left for the airport a bit earlier than necessary and this proved to be a wise move as later on getting out of the centre of Barcelona proved to be a bit of a problem to our fellow airline passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Good, accessible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zizu123
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel ideally located near the Barrio Gotico and within walking distance of most interesting sights. The hotel got well adapted rooms if you are in a wheelchair. The breakfast is good and the staff is helpful. We would probably stay there if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: McWig
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed one night but we liked this hotel. The location is fantastic, and really close to the metro and plaza catalunya for taxis and airport buses. A few nice restaurants nearby, but it is so close to the centre you may as well go there. Close to shops and la rambla. Staff were helpful enough, we booked a double room and got one with 3 single beds? Room ok, air con didn't work so was a bit hot. Good wifi connection in rooms and all free. Only problem was no safe in room and they charge €5 per day for safety deposit box. TV in room but didn't try it. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment. Pool very small. Good bathroom with powerful shower. I must say though that because of the location it is very noisy, but we were in a room at the front. Burger King just up the street if you like that sort of thing :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnydaysarehere
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at this hotel. It is a fantastic location (close to all major sights and easy to get around), staff are very friendly and helped with any questions.. The rooms are a little basic but to be honest we were hardly in it. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom and a very good shower. The breakfast buffet offered bread, cheese, ham, fruit, cereal, yoghurts, pastries, coffee and juice. It was quite bland but did the job. If you want a good location for reasonable price - this is a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: nipnlap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January 2012 and it was really nice. Very basic but centered right in the middle of the city. Perfect location. You can walk to La Rambla, Ribera, El Born, Gothic Cathedral, and the harbor. The beds don't look comfortable in the pictures but they are surprisingly comfortable! We were on a courtyard window and were able to open the window. The city is so quiet at night (Not like NYC with honking all night). The room was very quiet although you could hear people in the hall and people through the bathroom. I highly recommend for a perfect location and comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: metuken
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona for 5 days in October and stayed at HCC Montblanc for the entire time. I arrived in Barcelona in the early morning. As expected, my room was not ready so early in the day. The desk staff took care of my bags and provided a room were I could change into fresh clothing. My room 131 was clean, simple. It faced the interior courtyard which reduced the street noise quite a bit. The room had a balcony with allowed for opening the window at night. The hotel is across the street from a subway station. Barcelona is a wonderful city. For the money spent, this hotel was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Random_Critic
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a brilliant location right on the edge of the gothic quarter, 5 minutes walk from the Aerobus to the airport, and after much searching before going was what we considered to be the best value for money. There is cheaper accomodation to be had further out, but being able to walk everywhere makes the holiday so much easier I think. We were not disappointed with the hotel that we chose. The only downside of this hotel was that we could hear everything happening in next door's bathroom and i'm sure they could also hear us! Other than that it was quiet, clean, comfortable with helpful staff and an 11AM checkout which makes things very easy. They also stored our luggage safely all day for our evening flight. It is worth stating again how great this location is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Helen144
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting all the main sites as there were 2 underground stations within a 5 minute walk. Plenty of places to eat nearby. We had a room at the back which was very quiet and surprisingly the views were pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: christyEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights , Sept 2011 before going on a cruise. The hotel is well situated, a 4 minute walk from the Cathedral, lots of restaurants, bars, shops just around the corner. The hotel is slightly dated but clean and comfortable. The reception & bar staff were efficient and helpful and spoke a multitude of languages. The buffet breakfast was adequate, the usual assortment of fruit, cereal, meat, cheese, yoghurts, pastries, bread, fruit juice, tea, coffee & bottled water. The hotel was busy and at busy times the dining room could not accommodate everyone, which resulted in people cueing at the entrance to the dining room. The hotel pool and sun deck was a bonus and pleasant to relax on after a full day of sightseeing. The bar prices in the hotel were average for soft drinks and beer, but be aware that shorts are very expensive (vodka & coke and a gin & tonic was 25 euros !) A very interesting city, Segrada Familia is a must. The many reports and warnings about pick pockets are real. We personally did not experience any problems, but I did not use a handbag and my husband wore a money belt (inside his trousers) however we heard many stories of people being robbed, in railway/tube stations, on the street, in restaurants & shops, so please take the warnings seriously and take sensible precautions, as theft spoiled many people's stay in the city, which is a great shame as it is a beautiful and interesting city, with much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Isis918
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in August 2011. Fantastic Location within a short walk to La Ramblas for shopping and exploring Barcelona - yet quiet to allow you to rest and recoup for another exiciting day. Rooms are clean and a good size with very comfortable beds. Bathrooms have a tub as well as a shower. Staff are friendly and helpful and can recommend good restaurants too. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “HCC Montblanc Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MU-9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the hotel well appointed, close to necessary facilities. We actually could not have wanted more from a hotel room. It was a most comfortable respite from the hustle and bustle - and heat, when you needed it and we found the plunge pool very welcome and well sited for sunshine. All staff were very pleasant and accommodating. Breakfasts provided a host of options and gave a very welcome start to the day - staff worked hard to cater for often large numbers. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, extremely good location !”
Reviews.Author: SophieC60
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location, close to the subway, close to the oldest area of the city and right next to La Ramblas where you can party all night... if you want. Rooms are very clean, great size bathroom, comfortable beds. Swimming pool and 1st floor. that was the only disappointing thing. I thought it would have been on the rooftop. The breakfast is also very good and you can ask them to prepare eggs to your taste should you wish for that. Oh, dont forget to ask for an espresso they also make good ones.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sanpedra
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel...the location is near to the centre of barcelona....from it you shuld add the ramblas and the most important and famous place of city!the hotel staff are so kind and nice...good

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault”
Reviews.Author: ThailandAddict
Reviews.Content: Checked out this Hotel on Trip advisor, and lived up and beyond expectations.. Stayed four nights Friday to Tuesday. Hotel was spotlessly clean in all areas, Room was large and quiet on the 6th floor, staff were friendly, Breakfast typical continental but was fresh and plentiful. Hotel has great location from the aerpbus stop in central Barcelona and you have a choice of metro stations on your doorstep, not that they were needed as everything was easily walked too even for me. Swimming pool was small and not heated but very refreshing after a long day, area was always quiet, pool towels were available but service non exsistant but then whats the point if no one there a great deal. Would reccomend this hotel and would stay there again and again. Good tip to get to the beach go to the olympic stop its 3 away from metro station outside hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jacksam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great few days in Barcelona. I travelled with my mum, who is in her late seventies, so I wanted a central location, so we did not have to walk too far. This hotel was perfectly situated. It is close to La Ramblas, the historic quarter, the shops, and not too far to the port ( with plenty of cafes and bars for ' pit stops' on the way!). It is close to a metro stop. Our room was a reasonable size, and it was really clean ( as was the rest of the hotel). The breakfast buffet was excellent. No cooked choices, but a fabulous choice of food for a continental breakfast. You won't go hungry! There is an outside, very small, pool. I did not use the pool, but we did enjoy relaxing on the sunloungers in the late afternoon. Prices for drinks at the pool were high, as you would expect from a hotel bar. ( Over seven euros for two small diet cokes). The staff were really friendly and helpful. Overall, this fitted our needs perfectly, and I would recommend this as a great base for your Barcelona trip.

Reviews.Title: “really bad hotel what a mistake!”
Reviews.Author: sandra g
Reviews.Content: Very bad hotel the balcony was "10 meters high" we couldn't see anything. It felt like a prison! When we had to check out we were asking if we could have another room for a few hours so we could shower us in the afternoon that was not possible. The TV was also terrible no music on the television every hotel has a music channel. I really hate this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: famtomerc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a pre-cruise stay. The location is perfect for sightseeing and the price is very good. The only drawback is that the rooms are very small (as they all are in the historic area of Barcelona) and had to book two rooms for a family of four. They don't have connecting rooms so we had the rooms one in front of the other. This was ok with us since we have preteen, and well behaved, kids (10 &12); this would have been a problem when they were younger... it is ideal for couples and families with older kids. The complementary breakfast is always good to have and was pretty good; different from the american diet, but good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for position and service”
Reviews.Author: JerryBolton
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as is used my my now redundant Air Miles account so cannot comment on the value. However, a quick bit of research showed is was evry near the centre and the drop off from the city terminal of the airport bus. True to that, the bus stop was about four minutes walk away and I was greeted by name (crikey!), probably as I was travelling with my ten year old son and we had told the hotel we were arriving late, but even so, that was a good start. Bedroom was large enough, clean bathroom and a street view. One slight thing here was that one morning I heard a shower going, then the shower curtain being drawn back. Nothing much, but if there were rowdy neighbours, you'd hear everything. Anyway, breakfast is entirely self service and caters for almost any taste with a large variety of foods to choose from. The pool on the first floor is small but good enough to refresh after a long day The hotel is ideally situated between the harbour/Rambla and the shopping distric as well as near to La Catalunya metro from where you can access most of what you want to see. One final point, when I asked about visiting the water park, the lady at reception got a map out to show La Gracia station from where I should depart and then, whilst on the phone to the rail network with one hand and the internet on the other, produced a timetable of the departures there and back Very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: thierry_grenade
Reviews.Content: Large rooms. Clean. AC. Small swiming pool. Very well located. Quite cheap for this kind of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient, and good value”
Reviews.Author: SussexKazzy
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay in a comfortable room on the second floor, We heard some street noise but this did not go on late or start early. Breakfast was self service, and although there was a menu of hot food, we were never asked if we wanted anything. Coffee was horrid, and hot water for tea was in short supply. No tea/coffee making facilities in room. Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable, The location was fantastic, close to then last stop on the airport bus, close to the tour buses and one street away from Las Ramblas. An enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Value , would stay again”
Reviews.Author: normajean77
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the Ramblas, nice reception area , room was on the side of the hotel and faced a wall so no view but with windows closed no noise at night. Aircon in room ok but room itself was a little dated ,lighting a bit subdued and bed linen old fashioned , sheet and bedspread with brown pattern, lots of brown wood eveywhere that gave it a dull feel,large wardrobe with full length mirrors on both doors.Nice bathroom ,shower good but was located in the centre of the bath wall facing the shower curtain , strange ! a bit difficult not to get your hair wet as no complimentary shower cap but good flow of water and easy to regulate.Good hair dryer with nice big wall mirror.Breakfast was included in our deal and was usual cold buffet style with good variety of things to choose from.Hotel boasts a rooftop swimming pool but it is VERY small though ok.Roof top area itself very pleasant as surrounded completely by other buildings, warm,sunny and quiet,NICE.Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude arrogant and miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: chelle379
Reviews.Content: Great location , nice clean Hotel , terrible service , miserable rude and arrogant staff. Firstly had booked this Hotel for its location and because it has a pool and relaxing terrace area, then find out on arrival fri eve, we couldn't use it for most of sat because of private party and had not been forewarned of this ! Reception badly under staffed , no acknowledment when your left waiting for ages. Barman changed prices by the day, fri eve, vodka and coke 10 euro, sat eve 14 euro, his response " different day" !! Restaurant staff , appalling manners, asking for hot water for tea you had you head bitten off. Also waiter treated us rudely on arrival and then asked us to move table as someone apparently sitting there, we moved to another dirty table, and he wasn't happy when we asked him to clean it. In his defence he did come and apologise afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location and decent prices”
Reviews.Author: JiiH
Reviews.Content: Good, clean hotel with great location. Metro-station is nearby and walking distance from Plaze de Catalynya. Breakfast was good and plenty to eat. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Good location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: fionaanddean
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they had an offer on to upgrade us to their sister hotel that was a 4* and said that they would organise and pay for a taxi to get us there, but we declined as we had chosen this hotel expecially for the roof terrace and pool. They accepted that we wanted to stay and allocated us a nice room. It was spotlessly clean! The staff were all so friendly especially a hardworking barman who was very sweet and kept bringing us nibbles to have with our drinks. The roof top terrace was perfect, and suprisingly peaceful compared to the hustle and bustle in the streets below. The breakfast was very good with a wide choice of a continental buffet. We went to barcelona for a well deserved 2 night break and went just as we planned. We will definatley stay there again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & great location”
Reviews.Author: jmjf31256
Reviews.Content: Went with 17 year old daughter for 2 nights. Great location especially as we were only there for a short time. Very safe area. Did not eat there as there are so many great places to eat. I looked into the restaurant briefly and it did not look very appealing as it did not have any windows, however cannot comment properly as we did not try it. Rooms were clean, comfortable with an excellent bathroom. Noisy if you opened the window but we were on the back which I would definitely recommend (although the you lose the view). Only criticism was that I informed both the hotel and the agent that we booked through that it was my daughter's birthday and that it would be nice if they could maybe do something like a card/cake/bottle of cava, etc in the room. The agent said that they had informed the hotel and that they would. However, nothing happened and no one mentioned anything.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again if we visit Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PMD_63
Reviews.Content: Great location, very convenient to travel with near by metro & bus stops. Just about 250 meters from Placa Catalunya the city centre just off the vibrant La Ramblas. Plenty of restaurants in close vicinity. Good buffet breakfast, free wifi in lobby & restaurant and wired Internet in the room. Parking available if required. They offered a complimentary glass of Champagne. They charge around 5 Euros for the safe in the room which is a bit unfair.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean yet walls are paper thin!!”
Reviews.Author: Louielily
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, staff are friendly and buffet breakfast is adequate. No complaints with regards to cleanliness however the walls in the rooms are so thin that we were awoken regularly with the sound of the guests next door either showering, using toilet or brushing their teeth!! Because of this we left feeling exhausted with little sleep, this is a shame as the hotel is generally pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: delmi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Montblanc and , following previous experience of city centre hotels, was slightly worried about traffic noise and Barcelona's 24-hour city reputation. The reality proved a totally different and turned out to be one of the most comfortable and civil hotels hotels we have used. All the staff that we encountered were pleasant and professional in a down to earth kind of way. The room was just fine and we had 3 good nights sleep. Breakfast was the usual buffet plus the choice of hot dishes if required. Location is perfect and 5 minutes away from the Plaza de Catalunya and it's convenient 'bus service to the airport. I would not bother searching for other Barcelona hotels if I go again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandwDurham Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before, just for a couple of days, a few years back and we thought it would be OK. We usually go for 4 stars, but our previous experience suggested that this would be fine, and we were not disappointed. The weather was hell. We had rain, thunder, lightning hail and just one reasonably pleasant day out of 5, but Barcelona is a wonderful place. There is so much to do and so much to see. This hotel is well positioned for getting around, and it is warm (maybe too warm at times) comfortable and welcoming if you want to stay in. The reception staff were really helpful and pleasant, the bar service was fine (sometimes you had to wait a couple of minutes) and we enjoyed the piano player on the night we caught him. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We overlooked the main street Via Laiatana, which was great fun for watching the storms, and although there was some noise at night, it was not a real problem. Excellent for a 3 star hotel. recommended

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: MsVickiG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HCC Montblanc for two nights prior, and four nights following our Mediterranean Cruise. We chose this hotel because the cruise line (NCL) has a partnership with the hotel and we were able to secure transfers to/from the ship along with our stay. Other selling points were the free Internet access, breakfast, and proximity to Barcelona attractions. Other reviews on TripAdvisor mentioned that it was quiet and the hotel’s website also noted the soundproof rooms. We had requested a room at the back of the hotel, as we believed it would be even quieter, and the hotel complied with our request. The Montblanc is located on busy Via Liatana; very close to the Gothic section. We walked everywhere and we were not disappointed during our first stay. Our room on the 7th floor was spacious and very quiet. We especially appreciated the hand-held shower with very good water temperature and pressure, and the room where we were able to store our luggage before check-in. Our flight arrived at around 9am that morning and they kindly allowed us to check in early, which permitted us some time to explore a bit and recuperate from the long flight. The hair dryer worked well and toiletries included shampoo, shower gel, shower cap, and comb. The breakfast buffet offered a lot of choice and, time-wise, there was a wide window of opportunity to get there. We found the front desk staff very helpful and language was not an issue. We were a bit disappointed the pool was closed, as it was quite warm on the day we arrived, but we hadn’t really expected that it would be open given the time of year. Our second stay was not as satisfactory as our first. We were given a room on the fourth floor at the rear of the hotel, but the window hinge was broken and, as a result, the room was not sound-proof. We mentioned this to the front desk and were assured it would be dealt with. There was an attempt to remedy the problem, but when we explained that the room was still very noisy, nothing further was done. On the plus side, I noticed the check-in card offered a free glass of cava between 9 and 10pm, so this did help us get to sleep. Overall I would recommend the HCC Montblanc as a good Barcelona home base or as a weigh-point for cruisers.

Reviews.Title: “City hotel - needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: jvdv
Reviews.Content: An ok-ish 3-star hotel. The location of the hotel is good. Just off the main shopping streets of Barcelona. The hotel itself is somewhat outdated. The rooms are clean but outdated. Themperature is too hot and can't be controlled/ If you open the window you have all the noise of the street. Not ideal. The buffet breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “amazing city barcelona”
Reviews.Author: popi45
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights at the montblanc in barcelona, lovely hotel, clean and welcoming, staff friendly, we had a room on the 6th floor, at the front of the hotel, it was a good size room and bathroom, there was some road noise but once asleep couldnt hear it, the walls were thin and we could hear our neighbours when they came back to the room after midnight and had a shower!!, breakfast was plentiful, and you could order eggs and bacon and sausage if you wanted although these did tend to be on the greasy side, we ate at the italian restaurant just a few doors from the hotel called Ginos, and had a lovely 2 course meal with wine for less than 50euros, we wouldnt recommend 'american soda tapas bar and grill' based on la rambla, the meal in there was awful and cost 70 euros with beer, we tried the house tasting menu, not worth it at all. all in all the weekend trip was wonderful, and we aim to go back again when it is slightly warmer, i would definately stay at the montblanc again, very central for all the walking we did, and we walked everywhere............

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaSmallF
Reviews.Content: I booked through BA Airmiles based on the location of the hotel and ease of walking from the airport bus stop to the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with what we got for our money. Staff were pleasant. Although dated, the room was clean and what you would expect from a 3 Star hotel. The bathroom was nice with free toiletries and we even had a balcony with seating and free internet access. Down side was that there was a charge to safe and also the lack of tea making facilities, although commonly lacking in some European destinations it still can’t get used to the idea of hotels not providing these facilities in room. On one occasion I wanted an afternoon cup of tea so dialled room service only to be told that room service was not available at certain hours so I had to go down to the bar and collect my tea myself and take it up to my room – I thought that this was quite poor, even for a 3 star hotel. The breakfast had a good continental offering but what ever you do don’t order the cooked breakfast – it is truly horrible and un-edible which means that the continental does get boring after a while. The location of this hotel is excellent and I would recommend it for a budget city break, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Rest not so great.”
Reviews.Author: Here4Holidays
Reviews.Content: Hotel is indeed in a great location - be sure to check out the Palau de la Música (almost) next door, and book a daytime concert if you're into such things (or just want to be wowed by the light coming in through the amazing stained-glass skylight). Urquinaona metro station is also on your doorstep, and La Rambla is also very quick to walk to. We stayed in room 518 which was quiet and away from the noise, but basic and probably not much changed since the 1970's. As others have mentioned, 5€ per day to use the in-roof safe is a bit of a rip-off, yes. Breakfast is nothing spectacular, and if it's not included in your room rate it's ridiculously overpriced (17€ per person - you can eat much better for less elsewhere). If you do have breakfast there note they will cook eggs, etc. to order for you if you ask - so be sure to make the most of your 17€ !

Reviews.Title: “other then a few 1 off issues, everything else is fine”
Reviews.Author: musumekiller
Reviews.Content: pros: location, location, location, free internet cons: please read below When i went, there was electricity issue, I was offered to move to another hotel that is 15 minute walking distance. However, the main reason I stayed at this hotel was the location. I wait for 5 hours and finally I was offered a room. However, there was more issue at night and I had to move to another room at 1am in the morning. I got free breakfast from Management. However, it wasn't in the system when I checked out and I had a small fight before I left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Reba25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of June - sorry it's taken me so long to write this review. The location was excellent just a couple of streets away from all the action, but close enough to go back for a break between sightseeing, shopping etc. We had a room at the back of the hotel so it was nice and quiet. The room wasn't the biggest we've ever stayed in, but we were only there for a long weekend so it was perfectly fine. We asked for extra pillows as they were very thin, and they were delivered to our room very quickly. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis, the breakfast was ok, sometimes the coffee wasn't warm enough. Public areas were very nice, bar area fine. We did here the piano being played one night. Overall we would stay here again as it is so central for everything and we found the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LauraLoretti
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very good for visiting, shopping and beach. The room was very nice, breakfast was good as well. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic location for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: sumacoo
Reviews.Content: great central location, just 5 mins walk from Aerobus stop in city centre. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Had room at back of hotel overlooking small pool, no traffic noise. Very clean, sheets and towels changed daily. Room was spacious, tv had only Spanish channels. No tea/coffee facilities in room but we were aware of this and brought a travel kettle with us. Breakfast quite expensive at 18 euro, we had it on first morning, but was very substantal and of high quality, really sets you up for a days sightseeing. Plenty of cafes around hotel for lighter breakfast, great value. Very good Italian restaurant a few doors from hotel. Would definitely stay at this hotel again and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position”
Reviews.Author: billyLancashire
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed at the montblanc 2-5 sept 2010 and found the hotel to be every thing we wanted. the position is great, 2 metro staions 2 mins walk away, the Ramblas and Placa Catalunya 5 mins walk. previous reviewer mentioned that you could get dinner at the hotel, we did and it was excellent value and the setting perfect, on the terrace by the pool. service was quick and friendly and ALL the staff spoke english which was a great help. any one going and wanting to use the metro check out the Barcelona card, discounts in a lot of places, but you cannot use it on the airport bus that is 5 euros and only takes 20 mins to placa Catalunya. we would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “OKAY BUT CUSTOMER CARE NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: bertie11
Reviews.Content: Reception extremley rude they need to go on a customer care course & learn how to smile No tea making facilities in the room ,Shower very small & flooded the bathroom twice, TV no english prgrammes just Spanish & German. Bar at 7pm most people would like a drink in the bar without to chase to see if anybody serve them although this did improve However Marc Antony & Anna behind the bar were the lovely & helpful There is a piano but it is never played Location was great right where you need it to be the room was very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: GilliJoggles
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, about 300 yards from Plaza Catalunya, where you find the city tour buses, the bus to the airport and the start of Ramblas. The bedroom and the bathroom were both a good size and the bed was comfortable. After reading reviews on tripadvisor, I e-mailed to request a room at the back of the hotel, which we were given. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We ate in the hotel one evening and thoroughly enjoyed it. For 22 euros each we got 3 courses, bread, a bottle of water, a bottle of wine and coffee. We were also given a glass of Cava each, which wasn't on the menu. It was a shame that there were only 2 couples in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay at this hotel and love it”
Reviews.Author: ScubyDoo
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and again it did not dissapoint me. We were lucky enough to have a room with a balcony at the front with a fantastic view over the city. The double glazing kept out the road noise, but I also think being on the 8th floor helped too. For those who prefer a quieter room, there are some at the back of the hotel that look onto the small pool and terrace. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the hotel is kept very clean. There is a small pool and terrace, just nice to relax in after a long day of sightseeing. The location is very good in the gothic area and minutes walk from the see front, La Rambla, Pl de Catalunya ( for aero and tour bus). Having previously used taxis from the airport, we gave the tour bus a try this time, very efficient, running every 15 mins. Its 5 euro single, 8.65 return. It drops you about 5 mins walk away from hotel, so we found it very good. The hotel is a three star and I would confirm that is about the rating it is, but I think its perfect for a good value city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunblebeaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in August, split between two bookings. Was able to keep the same room for the full duration of the stay and was just a simple 5 mins on the last night of the first booking to check out and then check in again. We had a room on the first floor at the back so absolutely no problems with noise, slept like a log every night! The room was clean and well made up everyday. It had the basics shampoo, soap and shower gel, although not a lot of it and the hairdryer was a bit old fashioned. There was plenty of space in the room and a large wardrobe with plenty of room for all my clothes (as well as his). The room was near the terrace and pool which looked nice wbut we didnt have time to go in. The breakfast was ok with lots of variety of breads and meats and fruit. It is kind of a continental style buffet so cereal, yoghurt, breads, croissants, meat and fruit with coffee and juice. One tip - get there early especially on the weekend! We turned up at 930 on Sunday morning and could just about find a cleared table to sit at. The one thing i found funny was that they had tomato sauce on the table - i think i missed something cos there was nothing to put it on! Reception staff were polite, and helpful onseveral occasions. One small moan is that ont he second time we checked out we were asked to pay for parking which we hadn't the first time!!! We didn't use the safe - just kept our stuff in the car otherwise we would have probably forked out for it. Great location only a few minutes from Place Catalunya, at the top of the Rambla. Metro station literally 1 minute down the road on the opposite side of the hotel. 15 mins walk down to the Marina area, and you could either walk or metro to Picasso museum, chocolate museum and the marina and beach. We ate at the resteraunt at the hotel the first night which was very good value, you get a starter main and desert as well as wine, water and a glass of sparkling wine, and bread for 21 euros each. I would stay at a different location nearer the marina next time in barcelona to get a feel for a different side of the city but this hotel comes reccommended from me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Whittonez
Reviews.Content: Very good value, as booked through Airmiles. Very good location - 10 minutes from Las Ramblas. Agree about the ripoff safe, but otherwise very pleased. Recommend you stock bar with stuff from nearby supermarkets. Road noise not a problem as good doubleglazing and air conditioning. Very clean, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you're cautious in room's choice...”
Reviews.Author: Monpetit
Reviews.Content: Due to the volcano, we've to change our plan and in spite of Creta, we have to organize quickly a sejour in Barcelona. We reserve thru SNCF.com. The location is central(100 m from palau musica catalana, 5 mn from cathedral and plaza catalounha).But...Via laetinia is very busy late in evening and soon in the morning... So ask for rooms in the back...and you'll be quiet...The only noise we had have been some noisy guests at night...(some people seem not to know other sleep at 1 a.m...). Bath is nice, rooms and bath are cleans, the hotel is clean. Nothing bad to say about the staff... So a good adress, centrally located and quiet if you are cautious...

Reviews.Title: “Cynical policy on customer security”
Reviews.Author: Rainbeaux
Reviews.Content: Pity. Great location. OK-ish on the room rate, but nothing special. Room was fine although the sound-proofing wasn't great and the street noise late at night was a pain. What irritated the hell out of us was the cost of using the room's safety deposit box - 5 euros per night + tax! That's extortionate, and cynical too - I read another review where someone had money go missing from their room, so using the room safe was really mandatory. Just a way of fleecing you with a (hidden) extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, great staff”
Reviews.Author: worldseeker52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights before our cruise. Great location. La Rambla within walking distance. Breakfast is the usual european continental and I thought the variety was good, not sure what people are expecting, it's not American breakfast. The rooms were clean, but the pillows were flat, so ask for extra pillows if needed. I found the staff very helpful, (thanks Laura). When I travel, I just want a clean room close to the metro and if possible, within walking distance to the attractions and the right price. If you are looking for these criteria, this is your hotel. To find the restaurants, as you exit the hotel, go to your right and just walk

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melCumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with a large group. It was basic but clean. Handy location as not too far to walk to Les Rambles and Placa Catalunya. Breakfast was continental with limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull, my wallet was stolen in the room”
Reviews.Author: tifilho
Reviews.Content: Good location, gentil staff on the reception. I'd a giant cockroach in the room, we take a photo, show to the reception, so they give us another room, next day my wallet "disappeared" with almost 50 euros, as the Hotel provides safe boxes they say that can't do nothing, because it was inside the room, and the Hotel Manager told they can't ensure if other persons acess to the rooms. It was a business meeting with 30 persons, nobody likes the Hotel, only the location was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: EC19031
Reviews.Content: The Montblanc is well situated in Central Barcelona, and comes at a good price. The rooms are somewhat dated, but with good bathrooms, and the public areas were immaculate, and the staff friendly. They recommended an excellent Tapas restaurant a few blocks away, and gave us maps and directions. Within easy walking distance of Placa Catalyuna (and the Aerobus from the airport), the Bari Gotic and the main areas of town. I'd stay here again. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but Starbucks is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: sallyglebe
Reviews.Content: Booked this through airmiles so no idea of price. Hotel is in excellent location - within walking distance of harbour, shopping area, Gothic area and we walked to Gaudi's cathedral. Staff were friendly and helpful, room clean and quiet (asked for room at the back overlooking swimming pool). Very good buffet breakfast, but drinks in the bar very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The positives far outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: JenLUK
Reviews.Content: Mont Blanc is modern and relatively characterless compared to some of the Art Nouveau hotels that Barcelona has to offer. However, it is comfortable and well specified for a three star hotel, with marble bathrooms, smart communal areas and a small outdoor pool (closed when I was there in November). It is very close to the Placa Catalunya (where the airport buses terminate) and even nearer the Urquinaona metro station. It’s on a busy main road but I could not hear traffic noise from my (inward facing) room. There are a number of positive things about this hotel, notably the excellent location, the large room size (at least mine was), the black out blinds, and a decent continental buffet breakfast (with cold meats, cold tortilla and cheese as well as cereals and pastries). I found out on the last morning that cooked breakfast can be ordered but at no stage was offered this by staff. There is also free ADSL internet access in the rooms (for those with a laptop and connection lead). I forgot my lead and was able to borrow one from reception. My key came with a card offering a free welcome drink of Cava from the bar (but only between 9pm and 10pm and if you can track down someone to serve you). The main negative was an outrageous charge of €5 a day for a key to the room safe (and that in a City that has a notorious reputation for pick pockets). Other irritants included a bath but only a shower attachment to fill it with, luke warm “hot” water for tea at breakfast, frequent queues at reception and slight dourness of some reception staff (presumably sick of the continual queues).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value - good location - well done”
Reviews.Author: hinfamily
Reviews.Content: A very very good 3 star hotel, in a very good location close to shops, harbour , and most of the 'action'. Excellent service , very nice facilities , rooms clean and tidy buffet breakfast the best I've ever had - something for every taste and then some! Would go back again . Pity the pool was closed but off course the sea was open and very nice it was to for November. Well done Mont Blanc - keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but hotel needs to be refreshed”
Reviews.Author: travelbuga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Montblanc pre and post cruise (4 days total) and found the location to be excellent. The hotel is in need of a facelift as the rooms are tired looking with basic amenities. The front desk staff are excellent and very helpful. The breakfast was included in our rate and was very simple and the staff very unhelpful. Many of the items were finished and when asked to replenish they said that they were finished - this was at 8:00 a.m.!! Also, please be aware that when a taxi is called by hotel staff, the meter starts to run BEFORE the taxi arrives!! Ours had a 9 Euro charge before we sat in!! When asked the driver about it, he explained that the meter starts from when the hotel calls. Having travelled all over the world, this is the first time I have noticed the taxi rip-off! and taking advantage of tourists!!

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the centre of the crown”
Reviews.Author: oldbones
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at another hotel that had described itself as within easy reach of the centre of Barcelona,but turned out to be anything but this. On our first day in the city, having taken an age to get there from our first hotel, I walked into the Montblanc to ask if any rooms were available. A very helpful and pleasant receptionist showed us the room and said she would reserve it for us on our return that evening. The room overlooked the small but very nice pool area to the rear. It was clean and comfortable, with a nice bathroom and all the facilities that one would expect. On checking in, we we given a gift voucher to have a glass of complimentary champagne at the hotel bar. A very nice touch, and a great way to entice you to the very stylish bar The hotel itself is located a stones throw from the central square and Las Ramblas, within easy walking distance of all the tour buses,attractions and bustling Barcelona. The restaurant within the hotel is very nice. It serves a set menu of three courses,beautifully cooked and presented and INCLUDING a bottle of wine for 24 euros. The only problem with the restaurant is its location within the hotel, which has no outlook onto the city and seems to be poorly marketed and so is under used. The reception staff are very helpful and there is a secure bag drop to leave luggage on checking out day. All in all, I was very impressed with this hotel,its cost and value for money, location and comfort are second to none. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Barcelona. Do not be tempted, as I was, to save thirty euros a night by booking a hotel on the outskirts of the city. The saving is soon negated by the tedious travelling and costs involved in doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tchai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a precruise hotel package by NCL. We have always stayed in hotels booked by cruise lines and we were always pleased. Montblanc is the exception. It did not meet my expectations. The room is spartan/minimalist. The beds are too firm for me. The linens and comforters need to be updated. The amenities in the bathroom are so basic. The breakfast is so so. There was no hot meal. You will like it if you prefer cold cuts and pastries for breakfast. While having breakfast the part of a ceiling (about 2 feet in diameter) fell down..good thing no one was hurt. The location is the only positive thing about Montblanc. The staff are helpful too. But if you can manage to get around Barcelona on your own I recommend that you stay someplace else. If you are looking for at least a 3 star hotel don't stay here you will be very dissappointed. I have stayed in other hotels in Spain so I know what I'm saying. This hotel is not worth the bundle of money we paid to NCL.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lloydie61
Reviews.Content: The Mont Blanc was in a very central location,but be aware that rooms at the front suffer from being over a very busy street. Lot of traffic noise all night. Reception was always really busy,with never enough staff on duty,although they were friendly and helpful. Never ate in the hotel so can't comment on the food. Nasty stains on the carpet in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottieTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Barcelona many times and we would rank the Montblanc as very good for a 3-star hotel. The bedrooms and bathrooms are clean, well-serviced and of a reasonable size. Although our room was located at the front of the hotel we weren't bothered by the noise of the traffic due to the effective soundproofing. If you wish a hot course at breakfast (fried egg, boiled egg, scrambled egg, bacon and/or sausage) we would advise you to order it immediately on entry to the restaurant as it can take a long time to arrive. There is a good variety of cakes, cold meats and fruit available at the buffet breakfast. We found the reception staff to be polite and friendly although the tourist information available at reception is limited. The hotel is very well situated for the airport bus, metro and the main attractions in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “2 days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 7Spring
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 8th floor. The hotel was quiet, secure, and in an ideal position. Restaurant was better value than in surrounding tapis bars

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbugz2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September. Greatest feature of this hotel was its location. About a 5 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya- the airport shuttle buses drop off and pick up from here, there is a central metro stop where many lines intersect and it is where you can find a very large location of the department store-El Corte Ingles. Just a tip you can take throughout Spain and not just in Barcelona is that you may want to find the nearest El Corte Ingles because it is here where you can find just about anything but most useful for us is El Corte’ supermarcado (supermarket) where you can stock up essentials like bottle water and snacks or anything you might have forgotten to bring from home! The very busy and touristy Las Ramblas is about a 10 minute walk where we found it very easy to find a place to have a nice dinner. The room itself was pretty spacious-we had a double room with two double beds a desk and large closet. Note however that the in room safe is not included in your nightly rate and is rented at a rate of 5 Euros/night. The room also had a small mini fridge which we filled with our own water bottles and drinks from El Corte as the mini bar rates were pretty expensive. One thing I feel I should mention was the very ugly and quite gross stain we found under our desk on the wall-I didn’t feel the need to photograph it as I didn’t want people back home to think ‘ick what kind of hotel did you stay at!’ That did mar our stay in this hotel. I also felt bad for the front desk staff as there only ever seemed to be one employee there at one time and they were always busy. This also made it a somewhat longer check in time as there were quite a few people waiting to speak with the front desk. One evening we called down for more towels and ended up having to call twice. Nothing too outstanding about this hotel-would recommend it solely on location, otherwise just an average stay at HCC Montblanc.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: ScubyDoo
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a lovely few days with my mum and friends in Barcelona. We were more than pleased with this hotel and will definitely stay again. Its location is perfect, within a few minutes you were in the Barri Gotic and within 10 minutes you were at Las Ramblas, Port Vell or the Placa de Catalunya. We had a room to the back of the hotel and were lucky enough to have a small terrace, the rooms were a good size,fairly basic in decor but suited us very well. The outside terrace was a good addition and after a long day touring the city it was nice to sit outside or even dip your feet in the small pool ( not heated), it kind of made a city break into a mini holiday. We paid for breakfast to be included. This was a buffet with a good selection of meats, cheeses, fresh fruits, pastries etc. I would say that this hotel is a three star and not over luxurious but suited our needs perfectly - we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: luckyreddragon
Reviews.Content: This place has a good location, but nothing else. They try to charge you for everything, ie. to use the safe in your room is 5 euros per day. They give you only one bar of soap for both the sink and the bathtub, so you have to keep moving it from tub to sink. The phone in our room did not work. The staff was very rude and did not speak english. The television is very old and only got 5 channels, of which only CNN is in English. There is no coffee in the room. The shampoo and shower gel they give you is in little packets and not enough to wash with, so remember to bring your own. My biggest concern was when they made up the room they left the window open and it had been left open all day. When I returned to the room it scared me because I knew that it was closed when I left. I tried to close it but it would not close. I tried to phone to the front office, but could only get have the message through. I waited about 1 hour for them to come and close the window. They did not see the problem of leaving the window open all day. You receive the breakfast buffet as part of your room rate, it is ok. Don't eat the eggs unless you want a coronary. They are fried in grease and come out half cooked. The bacon was also very under cooked. This hotel also does not have any tourist information, the map they give you is not very helpful. So before you leave find info on the web and take it with you.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rainyday4
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just returned from a weekend in Barcelona and we can highly recommend this hotel. The location is great, just minutes away from Cataluna square and within easy walking distance from Las Ramblas and the port and Gothic areas. Our room was clean and comfortable, no view but very quiet so ask for a room at the back as traffic noise could be a problem as the hotel is situated on a busy road. The bathroom was spotless and was well stocked with toiletries and even had a hair dryer. Breakfast was included in the price and there was a good selection of cereals, fresh fruits, meats, cheeses and pastries. The pool area was an added bonus after a long day of sightseeing. A great hotel in a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: dumb_rabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days and was very happy with the accommodations. The location was excellent, being only 2 blocks from the Playa Catalunya and the Metro station, a short walk to La Rambla, and walking distance to the Pier. It was walking distance to a number of restaurants, particularly our favorite, Tallas Tapas. Nice selection of tapas at a reasonable price. Close to great shopping. The room was on the small side, but had a nice small pool to chill after a long day. Great breakfast buffet with eggs and omelets available on request, pastries, bread, fruits, juice and coffee. Best part of the hotel was definitely the location. Would stay there again if in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “In the right spot”
Reviews.Author: kimkennedy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was friendly, spacious, clean (the daily maid service even folded our jammies). The location is just off Cantalunya Square so easily accessible for all attractions. The breakfast was more than adequate with a good range of food stuffs always offering a choice of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, juice and tea and coffee. The staff throughout the hotel were always eager to help and there was always one staff member at reception who could understand English. We were unfortunate enough to have a bag stollen when in Barcelona and the hotel didn't penalize us further by charging for the lost safety deposit key and did offer to keep our passports etc in their safe. Would visit this hotel again if going to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “An OKAY hotel”
Reviews.Author: IamFromNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 4nights with my teenaged daughter. This hotel was largerb than I expected for its 3-stare calibre, but coul dbe staffed with more than 1 or 2 people at the reception counter for its size. The room was larger than what I expected, but carpet, bed covers and curtains are pretty outdated. The location was quite convenient, but it didn't give me a very safe feeling walking back to the hotel at night after dinner. But , we were fine throughout our 4-night stay. Big stores and small local/market shops were jsut around the corner from the hotel. Two metro stops to choose from -- the Catalunya/La Rambla metro stop seemed like a better & sfaer metro station than the Uroquoana station. Hotel staff recommended a very good restaurant/tapas bar which we really enjoyed going to -- the Tallares Tapas. Excellent food at very reasonable prices; and a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well-situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alpha1Norfolk
Reviews.Content: My teenage sons and I all greatly enjoyed our stay in this modern and well-appointed hotel. Our rooms were comfortable, clean and well-equipped. The bathrooms were spotless and carefully maintained during our stay. The buffet breakfast had a huge range of foods on offer and was excellent. Dinner was local in character and delicious, with wine included in the overall cost (which was very reasonable). The staff were friendly, polite and obliging (and very tolerant of my mangling of the Spanish language; their English was good when the need arose). The hotel is strategically placed in the city centre close to the Placa de Catalunya, with easy access to many of the important tourist sights. We walked to a lot of them without difficulty. Easy access to other sites and the airport is available at the Placa.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: sneakychic
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a long weekend at the montblanc with 5 other lady friends (fri-mon). Hotel is clean comfortable and central with some decent restaurant/ tapas bars close by. The roof top pool is small ( more of a plunge pool ) but ok to dip your feet to cool off after all the walking round the shops etc. Only niggle i had was.. no tea /coffee making facilities..its nice to have a cuppa first thing.. we ended up doing the `starbucks run` each mornin.. lol Apart from that . we couldnt fault it.. and would use that hotel again. hope this helps !!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated but run for the convenience of staff, not customers”
Reviews.Author: Fudge03
Reviews.Content: Clean, efficient, fantastically well located, BUT... One of those hotels where you arrive, and there's a queue to check in, and one of the receptionists is ostentatiously catching up with their paperwork, leaving the other to deal with the queue. Equally, for no apparent reason, the pool didn't open till 11am, and, when it closed at 7, you were told to get out pretty ungraciously. On the last morning it didn't open at all. But, if you're prepared to put up with this offhand attitude, I'd recommend it - 5 minutes walk from the airport bus and near all the twon centre sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean/quiet room, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: mama09
Reviews.Content: Mom and adult daughter vacation. Perfect location in historic center of town. 28 Euro$ taxi ride from airport. (Beware of pick-pockets on Metro.) Close to cruise port. Small room was clean, quiet, safe, and adequate. Very limited staff, but staff exceeded our expections in willingness to help. Excellent English. Could not exchange currency. Thirty minute internet connection in lobby for 5 Euro$ was convenient and reasonble. Would stay there again, but would make own reservation rather than "pre-cruise" through cruise company.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain - Will return soon”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-and-Mr-C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. Location is excellent both as a base for walking around this most beautiful of cities, and for access to the metro for exploring further afield. Room 423 was spacious, comfortable and spotless. Can't fault the place. When you pay £75 per night for a central location in a major city you expect shabby cramped rooms, grubby bathroom and grumpy staff in a place you dont feel safe leaving your belongings. This place is the exact opposite, would recommend and will most definitely use this place again when I return later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...great value”
Reviews.Author: nztraveller8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great central location, the price was good 108 euro per night double room, very quiet and nice and clean. The only negative coment would be that the bed covers and towels should be upgraded as they are showing thier age...the staff were friendly and helpful...the room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good experience”
Reviews.Author: mmfromflorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at HCC Montblanc April 30-May 2, 2009 and found it to be a very good place to stay overall. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel and go out sightseeing until check in time. The room was clean and spacious. We were away from the street so it was a quiet room, the staff was helpful. We were given a free welcome glass of champagne in the piano bar and we enjoyed both the drink and the entertainment. The hotel is convenient to everything without being directly on the noisy Ramblas. We would definitely recommend it and would stay again when in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, "just around the corner"”
Reviews.Author: winsr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 days, for a little spring vacation in Barcelona. The hotel is located 200 meters from Placa De Catalunya which is the center of Barcelona. It is really just around the corner. This is a splendid base for a city vacation. The hotel is nice and clean. Room are of a good size, and the bathroom is OK as well, without being outstanding. The staff is helpfull, and very good at english. You will get all you need for a city vacation at this hotel, and that is at a very reasonable price! I stayed i a room away from the street, which I would recommend, the main street infront of the hotel could be noisy, but im not sure any rooms are located on that side of the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Expensive taste”
Reviews.Author: cybercop2267
Reviews.Content: Thought the location and the staff were great. The Hotel room was very nice and clean. The food and drinks were very expensive £20 for two Bacardi and cokes, Buffet breakfast £ 17 per person but eh coffee was cheaper than outside. The walls between rooms very thin - got three hours sleep on our last night due to next door talking and laughing and banging doors and when they walked about it sounded like a heard of elephants until my wife lost her rag and shouted out loud for them to shut up.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SEF2
Reviews.Content: I would happily recommend this hotel. It is a 3 star hotel (part of the HCC chain) and was clean, modern and comfortable. We booked a non-smoking room beforehand and were given a room on the first floor round the back of hotel. It overlooked a narrow street and we weren’t really disturbed by noise. The hotel is carpeted, which meant that we weren’t disturbed by noises from the corridor. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. Breakfast was served from 7-11 am. It was a bit basic – a cold buffet, plus an option of some cooked food it you requested it. We stayed from Friday to Tuesday and for some reason the breakfast seemed worse on Monday - the juice on this day was squash and there wasn’t much choice of yoghurt. The bar area was a nice place to relax at the end of a day of sightseeing. There were plenty of comfortable seats and a computer with wi-fi access. Drinks were expensive (a coffee was 2.50 euros; a glass of rioja was 2.85 euros; a glass of San Miguel beer was 3.65 euros; a glass of cava 3.50 euros; a 250 ml bottle of water was 2.50 euros). We were offered a voucher for 2 free glasses of cava between 9 and 10 pm, but we were always out at dinner at that time, so were unable to use them. There was a pianist in the bar on most evenings, who was excellent. It made a nice change from the muzak that was played the rest of the time. There is a (very small) pool and sun terrace on the first floor, but at the end of March the pool had tarpaulin over it and it was too cold to sit on the terrace. The room was fairly small, but fine for a mini-break. It was very clean. The shower was powerful, but unfortunately had a shower curtain around it that stuck to me as I showered and couldn’t stop the water running onto the bathroom floor. The bathroom also got very steamed up after a shower and the steam took ages to disappear. Toiletries were replaced every day: 2 shampoo sachets, 2 shower gel sachets, 2 small bars of soap, 1 shower cap, 1 shoe shine, 1 comb, 1 small pack tissues. There was a mini-bar in the room. I only used it for a bottle of water, but when I realised how much the water cost (2.75 euros for 330 ml) I drank the tap water for the rest of the holiday (it’s safe to drink, but doesn’t taste very nice). There were two single beds pushed together, with one, very flat pillow per bed. The hotel is near the Plaça de Catalunya, where the airport bus arrives and leaves from. It is a five minute walk from Plaça de Catalunya to the hotel. The bus took about 30 minutes and a return ticket was 7 euros. Eating out Restaurants outside of the tourist area were hard to find. On our first night in Barcelona we walked for miles (up Via Laietana, down Passeig de Gràcia to Plaça de Catalunya) unable to find a decent restaurant, before ending up eating at Ginos (an Italian pizzeria) almost next to the hotel! The food was OK – they had an interesting take on the Catalan bread with tomato (a sauce was put on pizza dough). I ordered the pasta with mushrooms. The pasta was fresh, there was plenty of parmesan, but very few mushrooms. We also ate at another pizza restaurant, Pizza Marzano on La Rambla, which is very similar to Pizza Express. The food was good, but expensive for what it was (1 starter, 2 pizzas, 1 bottle of water, 1 bottle white wine came to 50 euros). There are a lot of Japanese restaurants in Barcelona and we found one recommended by the Time Out Guide to Barcelona – Matsuri on Plaça Regomir in the heart of the Barri Gòtic. I would happily recommend this restaurant. It was very quiet on a rainy Monday evening in late March. The waitress didn’t speak English and we didn’t understand the protocol of how to order Japanese food (even from a menu in English!). As a result we ordered too much food, but it was delicious and there was lots of choice for vegetarians. Another restaurant in the Barri Gòtic that we went to on a rainy Saturday night (and we were just looking for somewhere to get out of the rain) was Ateneu on Pas de l’Ensenyança. There was nothing vegetarian on the menu. The food was mediocre and very expensive. I felt that as tourists we had been ripped off here. Vegetarian food is almost impossible to find on most menus in the tourist areas. A few vegetarian options are included on tapas menus, depending on the restaurant. Tapa Tapa, which I think is a chain, had quite a bit of choice for vegetarians (eg vegetable tempura, a tomato and courgette layered dish, patatas bravas). Non-meat eaters who eat fish should be OK, but I found the best menus for vegetarians were in Italian or Asian restaurants, rather than Spanish ones. There are also specific vegetarian restaurants, but they tend to be cafeteria-type places. Some restaurants are closed on Sundays and/or Mondays, so if you want to go to a specific one check before you go. For lunch we tended to go for tapas.The worst tapas we had was at Bisbe Restaurant near the Cathedral (in the heart of the tourist district). The food was mediocre and expensive. The most authentic was at El Reloj on Via Laietana (near the hotel). It seemed to have locals eating there, which is always a good sign to me. We also had lunch at Pizza Marzano on La Rambla – they have a lunchtime special of starter, pizza, coffee and drink for 9.50 euros. We had tapas at Tapa Tapa on Passeig de Gràcia (near La Pedrera) – there was a lot of choice on the menu, but the restaurant was very busy (it was a Sunday afternoon and we had to wait for a table). The dishes arrived separately and the waiter forgot to bring one of our dishes and had already cleared our plates before it arrived. We found a cafe away from the heart of the tourist area, near the Arc de Triomf – Cafe Napolean, on Ronda Sant Pere, where the coffee was nice, the toilets were clean and the prices were reasonable. Also the Farggi chain has coffee at reasonable prices (1.40 euros) Sightseeing Barcelona is an easy city to get around on foot and we walked a lot in our five days there! The metro is clean modern and reliable. We used it to get from Plaça de Catalunya to Lesseps (the nearest metro station to Park Güell). On our first day we walked around the city just to get a feel for it. We started from the Cathedral where we had lunch, walked down La Rambla, with a stop off at the Plaça Reial (with its fountain and Gaudí-designed lamp-posts, and headed to Port Vell (there are restaurants, shops, an IMAX cinema and an aquarium here - all seem to be aimed at tourists. Here was the only place where we saw people selling fake designer handbags and sunglasses in the city). We then walked past the fish restaurants in the Barceloneta area. From here we walked to the Sagrada Familia (via Passeig Picasso, Passeig Sant Joan, Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes and Avda Diagonal). The Sagrada Familia is a stunning building, but the scaffolding around it meant getting good photos was difficult. It looked good in the early evening light (we were lucky to visit it on our only sunny day!). We didn’t go inside – too many tour groups put us off. From here we retraced our steps (turning off Gran Via onto C/Paul Claris, which leads onto Via Laietana) back to the hotel. Day two was our art gallery day. We visited the Picasso Museum in the morning (be prepared to queue). Entrance cost 9 euros. This museum doesn’t contain his most famous works, but has a good collection of his early work and also the Las Meninas series. In the afternoon we visited the Dalí collection in Museo Real Circulo Artistico (near the Cathedral). Entrance was 9 euros, but didn’t seem worth it. It seemed a bit of a random collection (the main Dalí collection is in the museum in Figueres (a 2-hour train journey away)). Day three was our Gaudí day. After starting at the Palau de la Musica Catalana (nothing to do with Gaudí!), to take some photos of the stunning exterior (although it looks better at night when it is lit up, so we returned there after dark), we spent the morning at the Park Güell. (If you take the metro, there is a 20-minute walk to the park, part of it uphill.) It was packed with tourists and impossible to get a photo of the famous tiled benches! Entrance to the park was free. Although the park is a must-see attraction, we felt a little disappointed by it. After leaving the park we took the metro to Diagonal, the nearest metro to La Pedrera. We queued 30 minutes to get in, but it was worth the wait. Entrance cost 9.50 euros and this gave us access to an apartment recreated in early 20th-century style, an exhibition about Gaudí and the famous roof terrace with its almost surreal chimneys and ventilation shafts. Just down the Passeig de Gràcia is another famous Gaudí building – the Casa Batlló (the building with the balconies that look like masks). We didn’t go inside this one – just photographed it from the outside. Unfortunately there was an advertising hoarding on the building next door showing a woman in a bikini, which we didn’t want in our photos! The Passeig de Gràcia was one of my favourite streets to wander down, as it is full of beautiful architecture and lamp-posts. Day four was a Monday and most of the museums and art galleries were closed, so we spent the morning looking round the two main places of worship – Santa Maria del Mar and the Cathedral. Santa Maria del Mar is a charming church, simply decorated, but with stunning stained-glass windows. We didn’t get to see much of the Cathedral, as it closed at 12.45 (it reopened at 5pm) and we turned up at 12.40! On our last day we visited the Museu d’Història de Barcelona (entrance 6 euros). The majority of the museum is taken up with Roman remains (a large part is about the fish and wine industries), but not as complete as in other places we’ve visited (we’ve been to Ephesus). There was also a section covering the history of mediaeval Barcelona. Some of the information is in English, but many of the exhibits only have the information in Spanish and Catalan. The most interesting thing for us was a film showing the history of Barcelona up to the modern day. It didn’t go into enough detail for me, but did give an overview of the history of the city. There is also a small chapel near the exit included in the entrance fee. All in all it was a bit disappointing. Shopping Barcelona is a great place to shop, but it didn’t seem any cheaper than back in the UK. The main street for ‘high street’ type shops (Zara, Mango, H&M) is Portal de l’Angel (just off the Plaça de Catalunya). On Portal de l’Angel and on Plaça de Catalunya are branches of the main Spanish department store, El Corte Inglés and looking round this store can fill a rainy afternoon! For designer shopping (or just window shopping) walk down the Passeig de Gràcia (we discovered a lot of shops between C/Aragó and Plaça de Catalunya).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: melherb
Reviews.Content: This review is for our stay in April 2008. We found the hotel to be well located, clean, and great value for money. If you are after a hotel with character etc then this is not for you. This is your typical hotel which caters for conferences etc but it is well located, not far from Las Ramblas but without all the noise or beggars. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and more than comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and there was plenty to choose from. We didnt use the pool - to be honest it looked a little small but I'm sure if you are staying in the summer it will be a welcome extra. All in all we were pleased we booked this hotel, and would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAggs
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is great, and the price wasn't bad for an American Traveler; however, in the future I would spend the extra money to stay somewhere else. 1. The business center was "down" the whole time we were there (3 days) so we couldn't use the free internet, which was a high selling point for us staying there. 2. Our room was facing the main street (Via Laietana) and the noise overnight was terrible, even with earplugs. Lots of street traffic with thin windows. 3. We had the "do not disturb" sign on our door, and came home one day to find they had entered our room, taken the third bed (we booked a double but they put us in a triple) and thrown our belongings around that had been placed on the extra bed. It was very disrespectful the way they handled our stuff. When I went to complain (which, I never have before) they were very unresponsive (and I speak Spanish). At the same time this was going on, an entire tour group from Boston had arrived two hours past check-in time and a lot of their rooms weren't ready. Location was great, actual rooms weren't bad, but the service and noise were enough to make me stay elsewhere on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “UNDER RATED”
Reviews.Author: Teocle
Reviews.Content: **** surely. Superb location for city centre, main area offering vibrancy of beautiful Barcelona; ideal for picking up tourist bus, an essential for those new to the city. We did the red and blue open top on the same day. Beautiful weather. Access from Airport excellent. Definitinely recommended! Although too chilly to use pool, the pool area was a nice place to relax after a hard day's sight seeing with a large glass of wine - from the Spar around the corner! Ideal for smokers!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic hotel all round!”
Reviews.Author: Michsquish
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the HCC Montblanc and I can't fault the hotel- had a fabulous time!! The hotel is in a brilliant location, a short walk to Las Ramblas and the main square and quite near the Gotica area. It is on a main road but is not too rowdy as I imagine it may be if you stayed right near Las Ramblas. The windows must have been soundproofed as we didn't find any noise problems you sometimes find in a busy city. The staff were lovely, the breakfast (which was included with our booking with Alpharooms was fantastic -there was nothing more we could have asked for. The room was well maintained, very spacious and toiletries were provided and replaced no sooner had you used them, it was imaculately cleaned every day. If I return to Barcelona in the future, I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyle4940
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a small pool and a bar on site with a small patio for sunbathing. Great little place to eat breakfast and free internet. Approx 150 rooms right in downtown Barcellona. $130 euros a night + 15% commision for the agent. Great little Chineese resteraunt just down the street very good food and the best price in town for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: PangLondon_
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located roughly one minute from las ramblas and 10 minutes from the beach, an excellent location!! Staff are very friendly, have just come back from a 4 night stay at this hotel..guests are given complimentary champagne!! Rooms nice size, bathroom is lovely and clean and the shower is amazing!! The AC is great, mini bar is spacious enough to put your own items in, room service menu is amazing!! Reccommend the cheese sandwiches, only fault is the noise of the cleaners cleaning adjacent rooms at about 10am, but then again most people would be up by this time. Will be going back next year or year after!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate, but not very special - but has free parking”
Reviews.Author: ndakin
Reviews.Content: If you're driving it's easy to find and has free secure underground parking. The location is great, very central and convenient but not a in particularly picturesque part of the city. When we checked in we confirmed that we had booked two non smoking rooms but one of them absolutely stank of tobacco. I went to reception to ask for a room change and the previously quite friendly receptionist bluntly told me "but it is a no smoking room"! I explained that it was irrelevant because someone had definately been smoking in there and I had to stand my ground to get it changed. I was told that all they could give me was another room in separate part of the hotel away from my children's room (I got the impression that she was hoping that would put me off!) but my kids are 18 and 13 so they don't mind being away from our room and I took the option offered but it was done with a bit of huffing and puffing. On the whole the rooms seemed clean, reasonably spacious but were rather bland - you could been staying anywhere in the world in a mid range chain hotel. One room had noisy air con the other was OK. I booked it because it had a pool, but be warned the picture flatters to decieve, it is tiny and it feels very hemmed in by the surrounding buildings, some which were not vey attractive - I can't imagine it gets much sunlight down there. It is also gated off quite early in the evening because the restaurant uses the surrounding area for diners. In the end we didn't get a chance to use it. I was quite surprised to see a security guard by the front door most of the time, I wasn't sure if it made me feel safer regarding the hotel or that I should be more worried when out and about in the City. To sum up: There was nothing fundamentally wrong with the hotel but it felt a little bit tired when you looked closely. It just lacked a certain something in a city as vibrant as Barcelona.
