I think with hindsight I would rather pay more and stay somewhere a bit more unique.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cleo034
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel on the recommendation of a friend and were very pleased with our choice. It's excellently located, close to the metro and transport hub of Placa Catalunya. Our room was very quiet, clean and comfortable- no problems with noise at all. We felt security was taken seriously and there was always a friendly security guard at the front door. Hot food was available on request at breakfast. It always came quickly once you had found a waitress but sometimes it was not quite what you had ordered (due to language barrier). We were very impressedby the evening meal - restaurant is closed in the summer months but dinner was served on the terrace instead with a set menu as well as a la carte. The set menu was great value and excellently cooked with attentive service pitched at just the right level.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: mooer1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my partner during the 2008 Moto GP. The hotel was assigned to us by our tour operator but we were more than happy with their choice. The room was lovely and spacious with good wardrobe space. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom and looked newly fitted. The only down size with the bedroom was, as lots have people have mentioned, the double bed was two singles pushed together. The continental breakfast was full of choice and very filling but the cooked options you could choose if you managed to flag down a waitress were hit and miss, both food wise and whether what you ordered was what you received. Overall a lovely hotel, central located and well worth consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: boycie86
Reviews.Content: I went through Ryanair for both my flights and accomadation. My girlfriend and I flew into Reus Airport from Dublin. Its roughly an hour and a half by bus to Barcelona Sants Bus Station(€18 round trip) and don't be sceptical about flying in here as local bus operaters travel in tandem with the flights so you wont get stranded!!!! We stayed for 3 nights and on arrival was immediately impressed with the location of hotel and the staff. We were booked in immediately. Its the perfect base if your going to be on the go alot. €330 for 3 nights for 2 people, its hard to complain with a price like that. The hotel is literally a few minutes walk to the placa del catalunya. The location was a major factor for us choosing the hotel. The rooms were quiet and always well cleaned(towels... etc). Their was a tv in the room with various channels (spainish,english & german!!!) The rooms were a decent size and had air conditioning. The safety deposit box was less then €5 per day to rent. We didn't eat in the hotel but had a drink one of the nights in the bar. The bar wouldnt be alot to shout about as its small but Ramblas is only a 5min walk so that doesn't make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mahlerfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in April 2008. I reserved a single room but was upgraded to a double. The room was quite spacious by European standards and was clean and comfortable. While the room faced a major thoroughfare, it was fairly quiet and unlike some other reviewers, I had no difficulty falling sleep or staying asleep. The location was excellent, two blocks from Las Ramblas, Placa Catalunya, and the Barri Gotic.

Reviews.Title: “Our worst hotel experience - ever!”
Reviews.Author: Joycey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mont Blanc Barcelona as a pre-cruise stay booked by Norwegian Cruise Lines Within 24 hours my bag had been stolen from inside the hotel. The thieves remained on the premises. Only my husband’s intervention prevented them from going to our room and emptying the safe. Staff later let slip that there had been another theft which was from a safe on the same day. Security at this hotel is dire. One reason is that the room and safe keys are both clearly marked with the room number. No-one was on security even at the weekend when there were about one hundred or more NCL guests and the function rooms were being used by people from outside the hotel. CCTV cameras were unavailable. Staff assured me they would report the theft to the police but failed to do so leaving me with no time left to report it before the coach arrived to take us to the ship. After the theft hotel staff were extremely rude and patronising to me, thus adding insult to injury. No-one from the hotel came to speak to me nor was there anywhere private to go to discuss what had happened. They made it very clear that although the theft happened in their hotel it was my lookout and they couldn’t care less. Other than that the room which overlooked the pool terrace was quiet with comfortable beds, adequate storage and an exercise bike. Breakfast was buffet style and mediocre with thermos jugs of coffee and hot water. Eggs and bacon was available on request. We paid £169 each for two nights bed and breakfast in a double room.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: KateandSteve
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position to explore Barcelona from the Plaza Catalunya to Barceloneta and Port Vell. It's clean and comfortable with an adequate breakfast buffet. (Not as spectacular as some other reviewers have stated.) The bar prices are very good and the atmosphere is friendly but unobtrusive. We were very happy with our stay, once we'd asked for extra pillows! I would say that, if you enjoy a bath, you'll only be comfortable having one here if you're less than 5' tall. Otherwise, stick to the shower! It's easy to get to from the bus station or metro, close to Urquinaona station, and 5 minutes walk from the Tourist bus hub at the Plaza Catalunya. I like the idea of a free glass of bubbly on presentation of your card at the bar but bear in mind it's only between 9 and 10pm so plan your evening carefully. That said, this is Spain and many good restaurants don't even THINK of opening until 8.30pm or later. We would stay here again, but definitely for longer. A great location for a base and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireTraveller_7
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a very good location. Lots in walking distance. Nice helpful staff and overall clean hotel. The room was fine, although ours was noisy due to the traffic, as we were on the side of a very busy road. Even the double glazing didn't help (that might have been because the window framed was warped, which the staff weren't too concerned about but did give us the opportunity to swap rooms). Next time (and we would stay there again) we would request a room overlooking the courtyard. We walked around the area including many of the narrow streets at night and always felt relaxed. Barcelona is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for tour groups”
Reviews.Author: City-trippers
Reviews.Content: Not recommended if you want to get some peace, quiet and sleep. On the first night we were kept awake until 3 a.m. by a large group talking loudly in the corridor and then a group in the room next door who kept us awake until they went to bed. The next night the same happened but the two youths in the room next to us talked loudly until 4 a.m. (the walls are paper thin) despite us and hotel security knocking on their door. After this we asked the front desk to speak to the organiser. It was a Sunday and the Hotel Manager would not make himself available to us – leaving it instead to some very helpful but powerless reception staff. Our complaints resulted in short sharp bouts of noise until 3 a.m. Three restless night in what would otherwise have been a pleasant hotel, close to the Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...but good location”
Reviews.Author: bel80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February (which is actually a good time to go, well, this year anyway, as it was a mild winter, yet we were walking around in t-shirts!). The location of the hotel is very convenient. The metro is pretty much on the corner, and lots of food areas in the gothic area, and walking distance to las ramblas. Staff were very helpful and recommended a few day trips for us. Whilst the room itself was clean, and quiet, we weren't so happy about the bathroom. The bathtub was quite small, and there were shower curtains so water was practically covering the floor. Also their shampoo, body lotion, etc comes in sachets. Overall okay, but definitely not worth what we paid for apart for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Decent Room”
Reviews.Author: anonymousBA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a decent, clean, and modern hotel in an excellent area - close to barri gotic, la rambla, and placa catalunya. We had originally booked the Hotel Del Mar as a pre-cruise stay to discover Barcelona, but was transferred to this hotel as the Hotel Del Mar did not have availability due to air conditioning problems that made an entire floor of rooms unavailable. I didn't realize that this hotel cost significantly more then the Hotel Del Mar (we paid ~$150 USD, which didn't change with the change in hotels). Even though most hotels in Barcelona are fairly expensive, I personally would not pay over $200 USD to stay at this hotel. However, below are the pros and cons: Pros: - Good location - modern and clean - our room (7th floor) had a huge balcony, complete with astroturf) - quiet, even though located on a busy street Cons: - price (you're not going to get what you expect for $200 USD/night) - mediocre service - hard bed/hard pillows - thin sheets/ motel-like amentities - relatively small room

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AG&MG
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Barcelona after spending 4 nights in the city. I travelled with my husband and two grown up sons. We stayed at the Mont Blanc on the 25th and 26th September. We arrived at around 9.30 p.m. and went for our Welcome Drink! which was served to us by a miserable bar lady who didn't try to smile or communicate with us in any way. The following morning we went for breakfast at 10.45 a.m. and we were ushered to a partly laid table and then ignored for a good 10 minutes. Eventually the waitress came for our order, which she did not write down, and promptly got wrong. We were made to feel so unwelcome that we did not bother to go for breakfast the next morning although we had paid for it in advance. The swimming pool was no larger than a jacuzzi and the decor in the bedrooms was very dated and drab. I felt I had to write to let other trip advisor members know of our experience which seems to be in contrast to previous reviewers. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. For the last two nights of our holiday (the 27th and 28th) we stayed at the Grand Hotel Central, also on the Via Laietana, to celebrate my husband's birthday. This hotel was absolutely fabulous in all aspects and so I feel I am in a position to compare after two such contrasting experiences. (I will review the Grand Hotel Central under its own heading).

Reviews.Title: “impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen.waugh
Reviews.Content: on the reccomendation of the tourist information office in placa de catalunya we stayed in Hotel Mont Blanc this september and were pleasantly surprised, it was as has been previously noted, well situated for the barri gotic, la rambla and the port. We had one of the rooms at the back and it was unbelievably quiet considering how busy the area was, the drinks were quite expensive, about double the price of the local bars, but they are hotel prices. the breakfast was delicious at 15 euros and room service was excellent, as was the mini bar with a chilled cava as a welcome on the first night

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !”
Reviews.Author: WendsPaisley
Reviews.Content: Every other review refers to this - you can't beat the location of the Mont Blanc. It really is just 5 mins from the Placa Catalunya, where you get the airport bus for under 4euros, and 5 in the other direction to La Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter. Our room (802) had a balcony, complete with Astroturf (!), and was great to sit out on as the sun went down. My initial impression of the room was that it could do with redecoration but it was very clean and comfy and perfectly okay for a couple of nights stay. As we were celebrating 'significant birthdays', a friend had arranged for champers to be delivered and this arrived within minutes of checking in. I was really impressed with this as it had been arranged months in advance and could easily have been overlooked. We also got a voucher for a glass of Cava in the bar which was a nice touch. The hotel caters for both tourists and business purposes but never felt busy. The only time we saw any number of other guests was at breakfast, talking of which, was lovely and the waiting staff efficient. I wouldnt bother having dinner in the hotel as there are 101 places nearby including an Italian next door. I'd love to know if it was any good - it certainly looked so from the outside. This was my second time in Barcelona and it was as great as I remembered. Tons to see and do but if you're there for only a short time, take the bus tours as you'll see more than you ever could on foot. One thing I did notice to be different was fewer people begging (maybe the city fathers have tackled this issue) and it also felt very safe to walk about at night. The last time I was there, I was told off by a policeman for swinging my handbag about as we walked through the Place Reial (I'm a female reviewer by the way!) All in all, Barcelona is a great place for a short break and it's somewhere you could go back to time after time. And that goes for the Mont Blanc too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Reception, Poor Service At Dinner”
Reviews.Author: ishani
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the hotel was pleasant. The hotel is ideally located and the reception desk was very good. The women in particular were very friendly and recommended walks and retaurants that were very good. However, our stay was marred by a very unpleasant experience at the hotel's terrace restaurant where we decided to have dinner on one day The waiter was rough and service dissapointed. They started by charging a full course price for a plain kids pasta meal and after some argument changed the bill. The pool was cold and small. Other than that a very friendly hotel. Cleaning of rooms a bit delayed in the afternoon. Infant milk wasn't charged at times and charged differently on different occassions. Indrani - UK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Close to Beach and the City!”
Reviews.Author: jpruzins
Reviews.Content: After spending an evening sleeping on a train from Paris to Barcelona, this hotel was amazing. The cab ride from the train station cost 10EU and it was located on a main avenue. The hotel is in excellent condition and the style is very classy. My friend and I arrived early so the hotel offered to hold our bags while we walked around the city until check in time. We were 5 min walking distance from Placa Catayluna and 20 min from the ports and beaches. The Hop-on Hop-Off city bus tour also has a stop right across the street from the hotel. The hotel room was spacious and clean, and the beds were very very comfortable. We even had a view of the hotel pool. Next time I visit Barcelona, I am going to book this hotel again for the value I received for my money. Its also a chain, so there are other HCC's throughout the city. Also, if you book through expedia.com or another travel web site and it says that the hotel is booked, try booking through the hotel web site itself. I was able to book 2 nights through expedia and 1 additional night through the hcc web site.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: weemanal
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a lovely stay at the mont blanc, beds were very comfy and hotel was very clean and nice. Only short walking distance to the big square and to las ramblas. Breakfast was yummy and had lots to choose from. Did not eat dinner there because the menu was quite restricted but there was lots of nice restuarants nearby. There are lots of things to do in the city like going to the zoo to see the famous white gorilla which they advertise on their website only to trail around the whole park and find out he died 3 years ago. There are lots of good and nice tourist shops nearby for souveniers and presents to take home and some good clothes shops too. The street artists were very entertaining at night time too, the group of boys who do a street/break dancing show across from the metro are very good and i really enjoyed watching them. A good place to go is the Hard Rock cafe in barcelona where you can also visit the rock shop for tee shirts and souveniers, it is very busy and seems to be the place to hang out. Anyway the hotel was very good, a lot better than i expected and i was pleased to stay there and all the staff were very nice. I recomend it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Selection”
Reviews.Author: RezzyNY
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor reviews for convincing me to stay here. First, the location is terrific. So close to Placa de Catalunya, the Ramblas, and the Gothic Quarter. A metro stop is right down the block, and if you want to take a bus, just about every bus route is right by Placa de Catalunya. Like to walk a little? Easy walk down to the waterfront or go north from Placa de Catalunya up the Passeig de Gracia. As for the hotel itself, it is definitely a 3-star hotel. Staff is friendly, hotel is clean, and the rooms are comfortable. The dining room is also nice, but we were only there for breakfasts, and only because it was included in our hotel rate. Otherwise, too expensive. If you get the right rate, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel unfriendly reception staff”
Reviews.Author: JennySunderland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location 5 minutes walk from Placa Catalunya. It is very clean, rooms quiet and comfortable as long as you ask for a room at the back away from the main road. Our room was on the second floor and overlooked the pool area. The pool is small but great to come back to after a long day walking around the city. The only negative comment I have to make is the female reception staff were not interested in the least. They need some customer service training. The male reception staff on duty in the evenings was very friendly. I would definitely use this hotel again as it is one of a few in the centre with a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: CH109
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this well located hotel for the price . Pleasant modern lobby.Only 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and central shopping areas teeming with boutique filled picturesque streets and alleys. Free glass of champagne offered in the bar on first night started our stay off well. Found reception staff very helpful with regards to directions and advice etc.Room was a twin one (with lovely clean fresh well appointed bathroom) partially overlooking the back of other buildings and the Hotel Montblanc's roof terrace and pool (which was tiny admittedly but only meant as a dip pool and very refreshing after a days city shopping/sightseeing )- useful to bribe the children with ,during the day. Breakfast ,which was included in our Expedia price, was a normal continental type selection of pastries, breads, cheeses, hams,croissants and provided a good start to the day. Stayed for 3 nights and as we had a very positive experience here we would highly recommend it . We would put 3 and a half stars against it as a rating although some 4 stars I have stayed in have not been as good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Price.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Barcelona for a day, before catching a cruise out of there, and that's when we stayed at HCC Montblanc. We paid about 110 Euros (which is a good deal for hotels in Barcelona) and found the hotel satisfactory. The rooms looked a little out-dated but were clean and very well maintained, as were the bathrooms. The size of both was good! We were pleasantly suprised with a small balcony outside our room. We asked for a king size bed, but they were unable to accomodate us, saying that the hotel was full. The hotel advertises that it has a pool but the pool is a little bigger than a jacuzzi, and was extremely overcrowded. The lobby decor was a little kitschy but the hotel was neatly maintained. The location is good, but it's not exactly on Las Ramblas. One must walk about 7-10 mins to get to one end of Las Ramblas. We never ate there so I cannot comment on the food, but either way, there are enough of restaurants close by to eat at. This is not the best hotel that I have stayed in but I cannot find any fault with it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: jsilveous
Reviews.Content: Other than the hotel being located in a good spot, I was disappointed. I was hoping for a shuttle to the airport on the day of my departure and they did not have one. I asked if they could exchange currency, they couldn't. I asked about local attractions, they didn't help much. The room for the price was a bed and a bathroom. I stayed in a room overlooking the street which was very noisy at night. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CB_Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and great value for money. Stayed here 4 nights. Price included great continetal all you can eat breakfast. Pool a bit cold but location great for a city break, just off La Ramblas. The tour bus passes right outside allowing you to hop on and off to see the cities attractions. Would thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Booked this hotel and got walked to HCC St. Moritz”
Reviews.Author: eyhchen
Reviews.Content: Apparently I'm not the first tripadvisor.com user that had this problem. Look at the review of HCC St. Moritz Hotel and you'll see another user got walked from the HCC MontBlanc to HCC St. Moritz last year. Supposedly the Mont Blanc have some renovations. Users should be aware of this hotel chain's practice. At least they paid for the cab from the MontBlanc to the St. Moritz.

Reviews.Title: “Montblanc Hotel - better than average 3*”
Reviews.Author: Candice-7
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in the centre of Barca after reading the reviews on here. Certainly a v.g. 3* - nearly a 4*. Rooms are clean, bathrooms all marble and spotless. Right in the centre, only 10 mins walk from where the airport bus drops you off in Catalunya Plaza. 5 mins from Las Ramblas and virtually in the Barri Gothic. Staff on reception pleasant but the Head Receptionist a bit stand offish. Breakfast not included in our break but we tried it one day - excellent selection of everything you could possibly want including eggs, sausage, bacon cooked to order. Lots of variety in meats, breads, cheeses etc but incredibly expensive at 15eu. Suggest u go out to breakfast - lots of places nearby. Used local restaurants at night as hotel restaurant had very little choice, the "menu del dia" was 17eu. Only downside was the incredibly noisy and rude high school group from America. We had to complain to them as we couldn't sleep. The patio and pool area very nice. Would go back after checking there were no school groups in residence!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great breakfast & location”
Reviews.Author: RHHATL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights last week. Had stayed at the Hotel Regencia Colon first and while it was quite nice, it was a welcome relief to have NO outside noise at night. The hotel was extremely clean, even in the public areas. I believe this is a convention type hotel but they have 2 wings of rooms. We noticed a large group of high school kids and asked to be put away from them. NO problem. Breakfast was extremely well done, the typical breakfast buffet and an offer to cook breakfast meats and eggs to order. This was included in our room for 103 euro/night. Great location short walk to the museums, Bari Gothic, Las Ramblas, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FJJ
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from three nights in this hotel with my wife, I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. Great location off Pl. Urquinaona and easy to reach on foot from Aerobus (bus which runs from airport to Pl.Catalunya 3.90euro). Room was a good size, bathroom excellent with bath and strong shower. The room was even equipped with a fitness bike (perhaps they were trying to tell us something ). The staff were very friendly and spoke English and the hotel was spotless. Didn't eat in hotel as there were many restaurants close by, one just around the corner called Cafe Reunion which had an upmarket feel with very reasonable prices.The only downside to the hotel was our room faced the street and there was a lot of traffic noise even with the double glazing. On checkout I mentioned this and was told if I had complained at the start, they would have changed me to a rear pool facing room. All in all very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Lukehead
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay at HCC Montblanc. Could not have a better, more convenient location for wanting to do alot in a short time. Very easy to get to from the airport using the Aerobus to Pl Catalunya. Cost 3.75E at machine right outside door of arrivals hall. Bus every 10 minutes. Can also purchase ticket on board if you have correct change. Machine accepts Visa/MC etc cards. Hotel is less than5 minute walk from drop off point but not in the middle of the hustle bustle of the major shopping area. Hotel is located on a busy street. If street noise (and it is a noisy street) will be an issue, ask for room at the back. Pleasant lobby area. There was an error in rooms assignment for our group but they quickly, pleasantly made necessary adjustment - everyone was happy. Room was very clean, pleasantly decorated, nothing WOW but more than met our needs. Actually more than we needed - never used the exercycle in the room. Weather was very warm and so was room. A/C turned off for winter season. We just opened the window for ventilation (room on 6th floor so security not an issue). Even with windoe open, street noise not bothersome. Heard lots of church bells and bords but didn't distrub our sleeping. Roomy bathroom. Very nice big bath towels. The shower curtain takes some finagling to ensure you don't wash the floor when you wash yourself. In room safe. Internet available in lounge area. Request password at front desk. Excellent cold breakfast buffet. Even Cava for those needing a little sparkly to get your day going. Breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, fresh and preserved fruits (excellent melons), local specialties (tortilla, Catalan bread), really good coffee, yoghurt, sweet breakfast pastries. More than ample selection. While no hot foods (other than toasts), if you can't get your fill here, I'm not certain you can be satisfed. There is a piano bar and restaurant in hotel but we did use. Small swimming pool open in season (could have been this weekend - it was warm!). We walked everywhere we went (Picasso and Xocolata Museums, Sagrada Familia, Casas Mila & Batilo, Cathedral, Musica Palau, Las Ramblas, Bari Gotic, Born neighborhood, harbor) except for a bus to Parc Guell. Probably could have walked there too but time was beginning to close in. Very good dining options in small neighborhood places going away from the touristy Las Ramblas. Seldom werethe menus in English but we did well with VERY rudimentary Spanish and polite requests for help from the locals. All in all, a very good quick visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Janwar
Reviews.Content: The HCC Montblanc was absolutely brilliant. We stayed on the weekend of 5th Jan 2007. I had requested a bouquet of flowers and champage to be in the room when we arrived, as it was my wifes birthday, and it was all there with the champagne on ice. The staff are really friendly and helped us out with any information that we required. And the location of the hotel to everything is just brilliant, 5 minutes away from Las Ramblas and 2 minutes away from the Cathedral. For a weekend stay, we couldn't have asked for more. Keep up the good work Thanks Dave

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Karen_and_Aaron
Reviews.Content: Based on other favorable reviews on the Tripadvisor site, my husband and I stayed at the HCC MontBlanc for three nights in mid November 2006. We booked a double room, through the HCC website for approximately €114/night. We had a pleasant stay at a hotel in a great location for seeing the sites of Barcelona. I would recommend it to anyone as a reasonable value in the area. The reception clerks were friendly and helpful, spoke full English and explained the terms of the hotel well. We were given a room on the front of the hotel, #212. However, as other reviewers have noted, the hotel did not look at any of our comments from when we booked the room online (we had requested “a quiet, non-smoking room”), as we were given a smoking room on the main street. Though we did have a room facing the Via Laietana, where traffic noise could be heard throughout the day, this noise was lessened at night and being from an urban environment back in the US, we didn’t find it to be bothersome, though I could see how others might. The windows are double-paned and did a significant amount to quiet the noise, as it was quite loud when we opened them to get some fresh air. I would suggest if your comments are of particular importance to you that you should reiterate them upon check-in. We didn’t feel strongly enough about it to be bothered to ask for another room. The room itself was spacious, pleasant, and simple, though somewhat dated in its stylings. There was a reasonable sized closet and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was large and well appointed, with a nice strong shower and plenty of counter space. The room, the bathroom and the rest of the hotel were all spotlessly clean. The free internet ADSL in the room worked well and was a good amenity. Cable television had only one English speaking channel, CNN, which was fine. As it was mid-November and only in the upper 60s, we never went looking for the hotel pool. The HCC MontBlanc is in an excellent location, close to many restaurants, the Metro (Urquinaona station is right across the street and Catalunya station is a few blocks away) and several tourist sites (La Ramblas is less than 5 minutes walk, the Cathedral is less than 2). We took the Aerobus from the airport to Placa de Catalunya, as recommended by others, and found it to be a quick and inexpensive way to get within just a few blocks of the hotel (roundtrip fare was only €6.80/person). We had good meals at both La Rosa Negra (Mexican) on Via Laietana and Les Quinze Nits (French/Catalunyan) in Placa Reial. We opted against including breakfast in our booking, as at €14/person, it seemed a bit expensive. There are plenty of small restaurants and shops selling breakfast sandwiches and the like for much less in the area. In short, the HCC MontBlanc is a neat, simple, clean hotel and I would recommend this 3 star to anyone looking for affordable accommodations in a great location. (The mess in the room photo is ours, not the hotels.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mlp2
Reviews.Content: Located right near Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya, this is a perfect place to stay and explore Barcelona. Staff were very friendly, rooms were sufficient, and the small bar area is a nice way to meet fellow travelers. Drawbacks: hotel recommended expensive, not so great restaurant two nights in a row. Perhaps they share profits with the restaurant, but you are better off exploring the area and finding your own places to eat. Las Ramblas has a ton of places, especially going down past the market area (Boqueria). Also small side streets near hotel have tons of restaurants. Hairdryer in room was terrible, if you need to dry your hair, bring your own or be prepared to dry it if for awhile...(especially if you have long hair).

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: candjv
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from staying at this hotel for 3 nights on a winter getaway weekend with a friend. Faced with a long list of hotels for Barcelona, it was difficult to know which one was best for position, cleanliness, etc. However, I cannot fault this hotel, it was very clean, staff extremely helpful and friendly, buffet breakfast was excellent, huge range of choice from cereals, yoghurts, bread, toast, rolls, croissants, pain au chocolat to cooked eggs, sausages, etc. Breakfast was also open until 11.00am! Our room was fairly small but very clean and pleasant, maid service every day with clean towels, etc. The hotel pool was closed for winter but looking at it, I wouldn't bother getting wet - more like a large bath! The hotel has a restaurant for evening meals but not used much when we were there, there are many restuarants within walking distance. Overall, an excellent hotel with a superb location, 5 min walk from Catalunya where the hop on, hop off tourist bus stops, well worth paying for a 2 day bus pass (22 euros), as you can do the two routes, north and south on 2 consecutive days, getting on and off as much as you like, each loop takes about 2 and a half hours if you don't get off. Las Ramblas just near by too and two of Gaudi's houses. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: GMMS
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by phone having found it on the Internet and got a very good rate - 100 euro for the first night, but it would rise to 140 euro for the next three nights. Decided to stay one night and decide then whether to move. The room was spotless, staff incredibly helpful and pleasant with advice re: metro directions, calling the bus company to check times etc. What impressed me the most was that I decided to book for the next three nights despite the 140 euro price and after booking, the manager voluntarily offered to give me the initial 100 euro rate for the entire stay. Would recommend it to anyone. I was travelling with my 11 year old daughter and we felt very safe. Pool, although small, a lovely place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Killie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 very enjoyable nights at the Montblanc Hotel. The hotel is very central it's only 5 mins from Placa de la catalunya, La Rambla, and Barri Gotic. The small pool area is also very nice after a hot day sightseeing. Our room was very comfortable,and clean, however if possible I would try to get a room at the back of the hotel, it's central location means there is some traffic noise. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice, restaurant at night was by and large empty we did not eat there ( we recommend La Crema Canela just of Placa Reial ). Staff were always very friendly and really helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: D10S
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Wonderful rooftop/balcony views from our room. Room was just ok, but views made up for it. Great location, a couple blocks from the Ramabla and quiet, centrally located to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ClaireG
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, presented nicely. Clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Pool was lovely area to chill after long day shopping! Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LDULITZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, ( both 27) stayeed here for 4 days on our first trip to Spain. This hotel is centrally located between the Barri Gotic, and other neighborhoods, and on a major street, which made it very easy to walk to places for sight seeing. The room was smaller than we were used to, but we have only been in US hotels, not European. The room and hotel were clean, and had no problem with us checking in at 9:00 AM. I would definitely recommend this hotel both for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Cubalibre26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very central, clean and the staff were friendly. Unfortunately, we drew the short straw and ended up on the 6th floor with a room overlooking the main busy road. With no double glazing, we were kept awake all night by the heavy traffic. The next day we requested to swap rooms and were given a lovely ground floor room overlooking the pool which was lovely. But we must have picked the hen party weekend - as again the shouting in the middle of the night kept us up. Ask for a quiet room here and you should be ok!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell you about the wonderful hotel we stayed at in Barcelona before our cruise from Barcelona port on 26 June 2006. The Hotel HCC Montblanc was a very good hotel. The location was superb and facilities were excellent. On arriving at the hotel we were given our room cards and also a voucher for a free glass of Cava in the Piano bar. We found our room which was very nice and it also had a exercise bike in it. The room was very clean and big enough for the two of us. Having a pool was a godsend as the temperature were high and after a day of sighseeing we could cool off by the pool. The hotel position is very close to all the sites and is just off Plaza Catalunya. Everytime you entered the hotel we were greeted with a hello and a smile. On the last day we were leaving the hotel at 2pm we asked if there was a room we could leave our bags as we were supposed to have checked out at 12 midday. We were immediately asked what time we were checking out and given permission to stay in the room until we did so. They very kindly phoned for a taxi to take us to the port. The breakfast was substantial and very filling and was available till 10.30. The only complaint I have is that the toaster was useless and just dried out the bread but there were plenty of rolls and sweet breads to choose from. If you want a good, clean hotel close to all of the sights chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice choice for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Tero Lehto
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Montblanc for four days during the 3GSM World Congress in Barcelona. I'd would sincerely recommend this hotel for all the business travellers coming to congresses, conferences, seminars, etc. in Barcelona. Montblanc was just 10 minutes trip away from the Plaza Espanya and Fira de Barcelona. Taxi trip was something around 7--10 €, so I didn't have to bother using public transport. In case I had wanted to use that, the tram connection is quite close by. For business traveller, easy access to Internet is definitely a big advantage. Montblanc delivers what it promises; all I had to do was plug my laptop to the network cable that was offered for free from the hotel reception. The room was decent, good air conditioning, TV, minibar and shower with warm water coming without problems. The breakfast was OK and I also ate in the hotel restaurant once, it was ok food for a busy traveller. The service was good, I got my wake up call as promised and they called me a taxi at 6 AM as I requested. While staying in February, the hotel swimming pool was of course closed, but in case I can recommend this for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in every way! Forget the 2 stars, it comes across as a 3 or 4 star hotel. Lovely and clean, polished marble and granite, mosiacs on some walls - just so nice. The pool is very small, but just right to cool off in after exploring the city on foot. So it wasn't a problem. We couldn't believe it was only 90 Euros per night! This hotel is only about 5 minutes walk away from La Rambla and about 15 minutes walk to Port Vell. Have a drink and some nibbles on the floating bar there. Great for people watching! My wife and I didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we found a lovely place where the sight-seeing buses stop, just opposite the En Courte Englais Store (excuse the spelling) called "Beer & Coffee", great for breakfast and inexpensive tapas. We stayed for a week. Our room was fairly large, air conditioned and totally spotless. We ate out every night. So many restaurants in Barcelona, but our favourite one was "El Gran Cafè" on C. Avinyó, near Plaça St Jaume. We would thoroughly recommend the Montblanc Hotel to anyone. We will definately be using this hotel again the next time we return - that's for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “very suprised by its low rating on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: rjbxll
Reviews.Content: This was a marvelous hotel. Very clean and did great buffet breakfasts. Rooms were very nice and the bathroom was well sized. Staff were very helpful and the piano bar was a very nice place to have a drink. The pool was rather small, but as I was there to see the sites and not to swim or sunbathe, this didn't bother me. There were 11 of us on this trip, not one of us had a bad word to say about The Montblanc. Would not think twice about booking this in the future for a trip for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Good city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surrey 13
Reviews.Content: A good value city hotel, which is near to all the tourist attractions. We had single rooms and they were very small, but ok. My room had a terrace off it which was lovely, but it would have been nice to have sun loungers, rather than just chairs. Room very clean. Bathroom modern and shower good . There was a bath, but too small to sit in. Room was overlooking the pool, and very quiet. Think if you were located at the front of the hotel it would be noisy. you need to ask for another pillow as the are very flat. !! Corridors do smell of cigararette smoke. Buffet breakfast was fine - usual continential, but you could have paid extra for a cooked breakfast. Coffee was excellent, but the water for the tea was too cold to make the bag infuse.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mont Blanc for 5 days in April 2006. The location is very central (3-4 minutes from Plaza de Catalunya), yet it was relatively less pricey. The hotel is clean and comfortable with friendly staff. We were extremely happy with our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a city break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean room, good size. Wierd pillows. Super powerful shower. Handy location. Our 1st floor room had a little patio, surrounded by a 7-foot wall which if you peeked over, would overlook the pool area (was a bit wierd and potentially noisy in summer).The walls also were a bit thin as we could hear our neighbours very clearly and loudly when they got back in the middle of the morning. A friend had a room overlooking the small lane at the back and said that it was quite noisy, with people walking by and from the Chinese restaurant nearby!

Reviews.Title: “The Montblanc" is a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanNYCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the “Mont Blanc” for 3 nights at the end of March. We could not fault this hotel. The location is brilliant. It is approximately 5 minutes to the “Ramblas” which is where there are a lot of street entertainers and places to eat and drink. In the hotel the rooms are clean, airy and comfortable. The bar is a great place to sit, chill out and have a drink when you’ve had a busy day out seeing the sites of Barcelona. The staff were friendly and the foyer is beautifully designed with a mosaic styled wall. There are also a few small parks near the hotel where you can sit and relax and enjoy the wonderful atmosphere. The tourist bus stop is about 5 minutes away from the “Mont Blanc” too. The breakfast in the hotel was great, with a large selection of food. This is a great hotel and I would definitely stay there again if I went back to Barcelona. Barcelona is a wonderful place and I really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for city break right in the centre of barca”
Reviews.Author: beechmark
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel for a city break in Barcelona. It is close (but not too close) to Las Rambla - about 5mins walk. The centre of Barcelona is within walking distance, as is the port, zoo area etc. Do note however that a lot of the attractions in Barcelona are quite dispersed. They do however have a good metro system and for the tourist, open top bus routes through the city - you can buy your ticket and hop on and off at every stop or stay on for the 2hr duration. I recommend the orange open tops which depart just outside Hard Rock cafe. They are much less crowded and no queues unlike red bus system. Hotel Mont Blanc is very clean, rooms are large for a 3star hotel. Air conditioning is excellent and certainly needed at the height of summer. Mini-bar is provided and tv with the usual news channels as standard. Bathrooms are modern and spacious. A major advantage the hotel has is a sun terrace and pool - very rare in the city centre. The pool is more of a plunge pool than anything. The only minor hotel complaint would be the reception staff - surly would not be in it! However if you let this ruin your trip then you're obviously usuing any excuse to find faults. The hotel bar and restaurant are always empty, only ever a few people in the bar later on at night as they return from the entertainment in the surrounding areas. Overall the hotel was clean, quiet and excellent value for money. Barcelona is nice but not one of Europe's many gems. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BonnieBoo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mont Blanc is perfect for a short break in Barcelona. It has an excellent location, the rooms are extremely clean and the buffet breakfast is well worth having. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent position close to El Born, Las Ramblas & Place de Catalonia where the airport shuttle bus arrives & departs. The only issue with the hotel is the fact that its on a very busy road, so, if road noise disturbs you get a room at the back. 1st night we had no sleep but hotel were very accomodating & moved us the followng day - peace & quiet, bliss! The double rooms are at the front & twin bedded rooms at the back - so you can't have it all! Rooms are all a very good size & clean. Rooms could do with a bit of modernising, but nonetheless they are cosy & comfortable. The pictures onthe websiet are true to form. Hotel surroundings are very nice, although the pool is more like a large bathtub! I would stay there again, but only in a room at the back!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredd377
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel in excellent location - 5 mins from Placa Catalunya and Ramblas, plenty of restaurants nearby. Good breakfast, nice rooms, very clean hotel and friendly staff. Only complaint was the noise - 2nd floor at the front, we needed to buy earplugs. Should have asked for a change to rear room or high floor. Having said this, would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the location: you're right next to a metro station and the centre of Barcelona is 5 minutes walk. Plenty of bars, restaurants and attractions nearby. Try to get a room at the back as the front side is quite noisy from the road. Mind you, pre-requests will probably be ignored as they were for us. The hotel is a good standard, but the piano bar is pricey and has service without a smile. Just use it as a base. Swimming pool is closed out of season. Agree with the earlier comment about needing longer for the tourist buses: you can get a 2 day ticket for not much more than a single, and the two routes are completely different. If going out of season watch out for things like the cable car up in the hills being unavailable. The weather in december was mild but not warm. If you see a tapas bar with a queue outside it's a sign that the food is good. As tourists, you should be able to come back a bit later when the queue is less.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mallika
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the Montblanc for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. Great location as it is only a few minutes walk from the Ramblas and the room was of high standard and very clean. We even had an exercise bike but used it mainly for hanging our coats on! We had breakfast 1 out of the 3 days and wasn't very impressed with the food or the price. I think it was around €16.50 per person so you are probably better off going to one of the many cafes near by. They have a lovely piano bar but drinks can get a bit expensive. My friend ordered a jack daniels and coke and it was around €12!!! We were suprised how warm it was considering it was November but we didn't even need a jacket in the evening. Barcelona is a beautiful city and I can't wait to visit again and I would definately stay at the Montblanc again. There is so much to see. The red and blue tourist buses are great but ensure you allocate a day for each bus. Also I would recommend heading down to the harbour and beach as there are some lovely bars and restuarants. One evening we went to a gorgeous Restuarant/Music bar called Shoko which is down at Port de Olympic, Nice place to go for a drink as it is right on the beach. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: FORELAND
Reviews.Content: This is a 3rd star hotel but def needs upgrading to a 4* by whoever assigns the rating. Pleasantly surprised at quality in an excellent location just 5 mins from La Rambla. Staff courteous and breakfast was very good for european hotels. Booked via Globespan airways but you can actually get good deals by going direct. Location in terms of view from room was not great but you cant have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nearly kept this hotel a secret but as we made our decision based on other reviews, felt that was a little unfair! We stayed at the end of June and we were so grateful to have the pool to dip into after a sticky hot (enjoyable) day, even if it was small. Would not hesitate to go back. If you are a first timer to Barcelona, want an efficient hotel, good sized rooms that are clean, comfortable and quiet plus a great location then this is the hotel to go to!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, miniscule pool, some very dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: r0bertb
Reviews.Content: Check in took ages, staff never smiled. We were given a room at the back of the hotel which had almost no light, though we were finally moved to a good room on the front of the hotel with a balcony. A room with double bed actually means two single beds pushed next to each other, so insist on a kingsized bed if you don't want a crack down the middle. The picture of the pool on the website is deceptive, it really is not much more than a large tub. Not sure why the hotel had such good reviews, but location is good
